meanings.sent1: The climbers reached the apexes of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The flag fluttered at the apexes of the pole.
meanings.sent3: The race to the apexes of the tree was won by the squirrel.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement reached its apexes when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting behind the apexes of the hills painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: The top or highest part of something.
meanings.sent1: The apexes of the building were covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: She placed the vase on the apexes of the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat perched on the apexes of the roof, watching the birds.
meanings.sent4: His grades reached the academic apexes of the class.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully placed the cherry on the cake's sweet apexes.

meanings.definition: The culmination or climax of something.
meanings.sent1: The movie's apexes left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent2: The apexes of the concert were the fireworks display.
meanings.sent3: The apexes of the play had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The apexes of the meeting were the heated debates.
meanings.sent5: The apexes of the novel revealed the unexpected twist in the plot.
